description_txt: stated on October 16, 2013 in a report linked to on a website:
quote_txt: The goal of Common Core is "to instill federally determined attitudes and mindsets in students including political and religious beliefs."

name_txt: Public comments at a Common Core hearing
description_txt: stated on October 15, 2013 in Tampa, Fla.:
quote_txt: Teachers were not involved in developing the Common Core State Standards.

description_txt: stated on October 11, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: Says "74 percent of small-business people believe that Obamacare is a bad idea."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2013 in a meeting about Common Core in Tampa:
quote_txt: Common Core means "there are over 300 data elements the government is going to be collecting about your children and about you."

description_txt: stated on October 8, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: All members of Congress are required to be in Obamacare, but Obama and members of his administration "have their own gold-plated health care plans that they're in."

description_txt: stated on October 7, 2013 in a speech to an American Legion in Little Ferry:
quote_txt: "Property taxes have increased 20 percent under four years of Chris Christie."

description_txt: stated on October 13, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: "We’re 49th in the United States in new businesses created."

description_txt: stated on October 1, 2013 in a Providence Journal commentary:
quote_txt: "Local law enforcement . . . will have access to the [Obamacare] Data Hub’s treasure trove of personal info."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • October 20, 2013

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2013 in an interview with Fox News:
quote_txt: "We went from $160 billion deficit spending in (President George W.) Bush's last year to $1.6 trillion the following year."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2013 in an interview with CBS News:
quote_txt: The "president has given 1,100 special waivers to his friends" for Obamacare.

description_txt: stated on September 3, 2013 in a Voters' Pamphlet statement:
quote_txt: Says Damascus’ disincorporation would produce "NO significant tax savings."

description_txt: stated on September 19, 2013 in a speech.:
quote_txt: Since Obamacare became law, "most of our new jobs have been part-time jobs."

name_txt: People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals
description_txt: stated on October 8, 2013 in a robo-call and video:
quote_txt: "Live cats have holes drilled into their skulls," posts put into their heads and coils put into their eyes, and some have had their ears cut off or are intentionally deafened or starved at UW-Madison labs that do research to improve hearing in humans.

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2013 in a letter:
quote_txt: Says "by reducing chronic health care costs in the State of Georgia, we can reduce the $32.8 billion lost each year due to lack of productivity and economic costs."

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2013 in a conversation with reporters:
quote_txt: "Virtually every person across this country has seen premiums going up and up and up" due to Obamacare.

description_txt: stated on September 25, 2013 in an interview on YNN’s “Capital Tonight”:
quote_txt: 40,000 veterans in Texas won’t get health care because Perry rejected Obamacare's Medicaid expansion.

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2013 in a Tampa Bay Times/Bay News 9 debate:
quote_txt: "Unemployment in the city of St. Petersburg is below the state average."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2013 in in a mayoral forum:
quote_txt: "Since Mr. Foster's been mayor, we have less small businesses in the city of St. Petersburg."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2013 in a Tampa Bay Times/mayoral debate:
quote_txt: "Unfortunately, since Mr. Foster's been mayor ... there are less people employed in the city of St. Petersburg than there were prior to his taking office."

description_txt: stated on October 12, 2013 in an opinion piece. :
quote_txt: Says "nearly 30,000" federal employees in Oregon were furloughed during the government shutdown.

description_txt: stated on October 3, 2013 in a community meeting:
quote_txt: When SACS came back to the DeKalb County School District to give a midterm review, we got straight A’s.

description_txt: stated on October 8, 2013 in in a press release:
quote_txt: Chris Christie "cut equal pay for women, calling it 'senseless bureaucracy.' "

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2013 in an email and social media posts:
quote_txt: Congressional lawmakers earn their salaries "FOR LIFE," which for House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi would add up to "$803,700 Dollars a year for LIFE including FREE medical."

description_txt: stated on October 10, 2013 in an appearance on CNN's "Crossfire.":
quote_txt: "Thirteen hundred" applicants in Rhode Island signed up for insurance through Obamacare.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • October 17, 2013

description_txt: stated on October 9, 2013 in a column:
quote_txt: "No doctors who went to an American medical school will be accepting Obamacare."

description_txt: stated on September 24, 2013 in speech advocating repeal of Obamacare law:
quote_txt: "Neville Chamberlain told the British people: ‘Accept the Nazis. Yes, they will dominate the continent of Europe, but that is not our problem. Let's appease them. Why? Because it can't be done. We cannot possibly stand against them.’"

description_txt: stated on October 23, 2013 in remarks at a party fundraiser:
quote_txt: Says Jeanne Shaheen "got behind the idea of using the IRS to target American citizens for their political views."

description_txt: stated on October 11, 2013 in an interview as quoted in a news story:
quote_txt: The federal government "has $3 trillion in cash flow, so we can pay our bills" and won’t default.

description_txt: stated on October 9, 2013 in an advertisement:
quote_txt: Ann Kuster turned "a blind eye to those in need of funding" by voting "against funding for our nation’s veterans, low-income women and children, the FDA and the National Institutes of Health."

description_txt: stated on October 14, 2013 in a robocall:
quote_txt: Says U.S. Rep. Debbie Wasserman Schultz "voted to cut off Florida’s veterans and their benefits."
